title: Diagnostic features of quantitative comb-push shear elastography for breast lesion differentiation
patient: The patient was a 45 y/o woman who presented with palpable findings in her right breast, corresponding to an oval circumscribed hypoechoic mass seen with diagnostic ultrasound. (left-side) shows the B-mode image of the mass. A stand-off gel pad was used since the lesion was superficial. The shear speed map indicates a slightly elevated stiffness at the lesion site with an average elasticity of E = 26.7kPa. Biopsy was performed revealing a benign fibroadenoma.
